inn1.comm: gentlest of looseners, miles outside off stump, and goes to the keeper on the bounce
lovely delivery, holds its line outside off stump, gets him to come forward and have a poke at it, he is comprehensively beaten, Sanga is already standing closer to the stumps
now this one tails back in from a length outside off, Shehzad is shuffling across off stump, and meets it with a defensive bat
Shehzad is away, takes some confident steps towards the ball which is quite a distance outside off stump, and clatters it through the covers for the first boundary of the match
again he is miles down the track and outside off stump, and punches this length ball towards covers
stays in the crease now, and lets this angled ball come in to him, and tucks it down to fine leg
fuller length compared to Kula, better carry too, but the line is in that channel outside off like Kula, and the batsman lets it go
Perera sprays one very wide outside off stump, got some movement but that started about four feet from the batsman outside off
goes for the booming drive, it is pitched fuller, and takes the outside edge on its way fine to the third man boundary
gets some width outside off stump, and goes hard at it, and the ball races away wide of third man
better line from Perera, fuller on the stumps, and he gets the bat around pad to flick it wide of mid on
gets him to drove with a fullish ball that is around off stump, it takes the outer half of the bat to go towards point
gets forward neatly to the pitch of this length delivery, and drives it confidently to mid off
he has this habit of shuffling across and outside off stump, that led to his downfall against Kenya, this time the ball is much shorter, and he plays it down in front of midwicket
this time he stands in the crease and looking to thump a back of a length ball through covers, but Kula gets it to nip back in and he ungainly hits it back down the track
bowls it fuller outside off, and now he gets forward and pings covers with a neat drive
stays in the crease, and plays out a length ball towards covers
Shehzad cannot go walking now with Sanga breathing down his back, and defends one on the stumps to mid on
well, that one was asking to be despatched, but he missed out, hitting a short and wide one straight to point
leans into the straight drive, but Perera gets a hand to it, the non-striker rushes back in to the crease
there is no stopping this one, Hafeez it is, who gets to the pitch of a length delivery and sends it purring wide of cover for a boundary, that was perfectly timed
goes much closer to the stumps, no room to drive, so he blocks in to the off side
goes still closer, this time to leg stump, and Hafeez happily whips it through square leg, the outfield is quick, but so is the fielder who runs in from fine leg to cut it off
driven past the bowler, MAthews at mid off is a bit wide, what;s more he slips as well as he runs to his right, and that made the single look a lot easier than it could have been
played out in to the covers off the front foot
lot of width outside off stump, and he eases in to a steer down to third man

shot! stands tall, lets the shortish ball come on, and punches it through the gap at extra cover, Mathews gives chase, and stops the ball, his cap comes off its bearings and hangs on by a thread, but he saved the boundary
good delivery, slows down the pace, he comes forward and turns it to mid on
goes down the pads, he tucks it away through square leg, there was some excitement among the fielders, could not definitely have been for a possible leg-before?
short of a length outside off, pushed towards extra cover

that is so easy on the eye, it was played so delicately that it was a surprise that third man had no chance as he attempted to run to his right, there was width on offer, and he timed it deftly past point
just on a length, not quite there for the drive, he pushes forward and the ball rolls away to mid off
goes for an ambitious pull, there is a huge gap at midwicket, but the ball was not short at all, and the ball rolls away off the bottom edge to the man in front of square leg

got 'em! Shehzad had shown signs of impatience the previous delivery, and this time he was lured into a drive outside off stump, it was pitched on a length, and moved away slightly to produce the fatal edge, bounced a lot more than usual too, and Sanga doesn't let go of those
Kamran is off the blocks right away, leans languidly, almost casually in to a length ball outside off that sends it through covers
now Hafeez shows signs of getting on with it, wonder why, they have just lost a wicket, looking to heave this one over midwicket, mistimes it towards mid on

oops, he had launched himself in to the drive, but the ball arrived a lot later than he thought it would, and he sort of tried to check his shot in the end, and ended up playing an awkward sort of push-drive to extra cover
worked away off the pads backward of square leg, Kula getting some inward movement off the seam
another one comes in, this time from outside off stump, excellent line, he gets forward and blocks

whoops, where did that come from, Kula has been getting it to come in, Hafeez trusted him, went down on a knee and lifted the incoming delivery in front of square leg, that goes all the way, what a shot

and another one, this one was outside off stump, but Hafeez used the wrists even more this time to pick it backward of square leg for a boundary, just went outside the line, and forced the ball with the wrists
fuller, almost in the blockhole, he digs it out towards mid on
cuts down the pace, the batsman was already coming forward, and had to be content with a defensive push in the end
gets just a hint of inward movement way outside off stump, he gets an inside edge as he plays away from the body, the ball rolls away towards square leg
almost the perfect forward defensive, picked up the length, saw it wasn't there for the drive, and came out to block it with a straight bat
Kamran goes calypso, shuffles across a bit, picks up a length ball from outside off and flicks it over square leg, one foot in the air as he does so
gets an underedge as he looks to steer this one outside off towards third man
plays out this one on the stumps towards mid on off the back foot

he manages to lure another batsman forward, not fatal for Kamran this time, it was also because he went almost half-heartedly at this length delivery that was miles outside off and the outside edge bounced well short of third man
two feet outside the crease before the ball is delivered, almost yorks himself as Kuila goes full, the ball goes to point
launches in to the big drive, gets it off the middle, also gets it to short extra cover
takes this one on the full as he takes a step out, and delays the shot for an instant to get the placement spot-on this time, past cover, and into the boundary
slower one, moving away, he picked it ages ago, stood tall and punched it past point with an angled bat, in the air, but safely in the gap, some busy fielding at the boundary saves a run
the runs continue to flow, this time a steered single to third man, there has been a lot of width gifted to Pakistan today

another example of the width, it wasn't a wayward one but still enough room outside off for Kamran to lean out and meet the ball with the full face of the bat, boy, he is looking so good out there, the result is a sweetly-timed boundary
played out off the front foot in to the covers
opens the face to guide a length ball to point
lovely delivery, back of a length outside off, moving away, and making him feel for the ball, unlucky not to get the edge

well, nothing much wrong with this one, it was on the off stump, a touch straight, but it was the batsman who created the shot, walking across the stumps, and lifting it backward of square, all wrists
better delviery, cannot do much with it, on a length and defended into the off side
too straight again, now he flicks in the air, in the huge spaces at midwicket, not much presence on the leg side for Sri Lanka, and a comfortable couple is taken
slower one, he was already into the forward movement, allowed the ball to come on, and defended it
gets on the front foot and tries to get this length ball past Dilshan at cover point, that is not so easy to do, Dilshan puts in the dive and stops the ball
played out to Dilshan at cover point again
raps him on the pads, they go up in appeal, he was coming forward and the ball shaped back in to strike him, looked to be outside the line, replays show it was so, maybe a bit of bat too
punched away down the ground, long on fields
gets well forward eagerly to meet the ball outside off stump, and pushes out to extra cover

Kamran goes wide of mid off, it was there in his slot, front leg went out of the way, out came the big swing, the bat face opened at the right moment, and the ball was picked up from the wide long off boundary
confident drive off the front foot, lots of intent, too bad it found short extra cover
tries to tuck him for room with the angled ball, goes wide of leg stump instead
picks up the slower one outside off quickly, bends the knees and guides it to third man
back of a length from Kula, he goes back to push it to him, some respite for the bowler
picks up the most comfortable of singles with a push along the ground to that soon-to-be-busy man, long on
some away movement, but far too short, he gets away with it though, Kamran stays on the back foot and hammers it to extra cover, got a bit too eager seeing the short one
slower one eased down to long on for one
guided to third man for another single
just a push, but a well-timed push, took two men to stop that, Mahela dived first but could not, extra cover had to tidy up in the end
flicked in the air through midwicket, doesn;t matter if there is no one in that area
played out in to the off side by Kamran, tidy over so far
flicked airily again, could have been in trouble had it not bounced just in front of a diving midwicket

oh dear, is anyone out, who is out, what is happening, it was full on leg stump and swept to short fine leg, there was a terrible mix-up, Kamran ran all the way to Hafeez who did not move an inch, the throw came in to Sanga, there were two batsman there, so he threw to Murali, who would have had to be eight feet tall to take the wayward throw, but the ball was in the end relayed to Murali, Hafeez thought of running to Murali's end just for a fleeting moment, abandoned such foolish thoughts, and Murali finally got the bails off, it is Hafeez who has to walk back finally
defended down the track
played back down the track
goes back and cuts it, but cannot get it past backward point
shortish, enough time to punch it down to long on
Younis Khan is off the mark with a neat tickle backward of square leg
the Younis forward defence, lunges out, head on top of the ball and blocks confidently
oops, a tight single, eases a length ball wide of Kula at mid on, and they go through for what was a very risky one
pushed towards mid off, some thoughts of a single abound, but they are rightly quelled
slower one, cuts in too from outside off, he can only push it back down the track
strides forward and pings short extra cover with the drive
much fuller outside off stump, driven forcefully to cover, and Pakistan will take drinks after shooting themselves in the foot
full on the leg stump, Younis squeezes it out to mid on for one
back of a length outside off, chopped away into the covers
Kula shortens the length further, and keeps it tight on off stump, Kamran plays it back down the track
slow legcutter at 104 kph, Kamran leans out to drop it to the off side, but picks out point
a foot outside off this time, Kamran chops this towards third man and gets the single
bouncer, of the slow loopy kind outside off, and Younis rolls his wrists over a controlled pull in front of square leg
Mathews lands one full and tempting on the pads at 130 kph and Younis nearly chips it straight to midwicket. Slow pitch, YK, take it easy! Single in the end
length ball on the stumps, Kamran punches it down to long on for another single

whoa, nicely done Younis. Mathews bangs it short and straight, just outside off, no room for the cut. Younis just arches his bat back, opens the face and deflects it towards where first slip would have been. Sanga makes an acrobatic effort, but it beats him easy
very straight this time, even Younis can't get it away and just defends from the crease
offcutter coming in from outside off, Younis works it with the deviation towards midwicket for one
Kamran check-drives the last ball into the covers to end the over
tossed up outside off and turning away, driven into the offside where Dilshan intercepts
Younis stays back in the crease and turns it against the spin through square leg
whoa, Kamran goes well back and plays the ball almost falally late. It was almost crashing into the stumps when he decided to execute the late cut.
on the pads this time, and he turns it away square for one more
Younis leans out to a tossed up ball, and works it against the spin for a single through square leg
tossed up again and turning away, as the right hander tries to inside out him through the covers
back of a length on the off stump line, forced away to mid on
fuller this time on middle stump, Younis punches it down to long on for a single
poor from Angelo, angles this one down the leg side and Kamran just helps it along with pleasure for four through fine leg. Sri Lanka have been curiously lacking in intensity today
nice timing from Kamran, more generosity from Angelo, full and wide outside off, Kamran hits in along the ground off the front foot to deep extra cover
Kamran works this one wide of mid on for Pakistan's 100th run. Strong platform building happening.
Younis steals two with some charged-up runnings, opens the face and dabs it down to third man where Murali hurries to collect and release, but Younis wins this particular battle of the veterans.
tossed up on middle and leg, turning further down, Kamran flicks square for a single
generous flight and wily drift towards middle and leg, Younis adjusts to get to the pitch and drive through mid off for one
air again, on middle stump and Kamran goes the other way, driving with the spin to long on
Younis chips out, can't quite get to the pitch and drives straight to midwicket
Younis reaches across well outside off and tries to work Murali with the spin to the leg side
beaten outside off, Younis lunges forward to smother the spin and Murali gets past him
full on middle and leg, Kamran forces it back down the ground

Well, Pakistan have lost three wickets. Kamran has taken more than any of the Sri Lankan bowlers - two. After sending Hafeez back with his wily running, he's now accounted for himself with an inexplicable unremarkable charge down the track. He seemed to have decided long back that, no matter what, this had to go over long on. And so he proceeded - to run down the track like a bull that had seen a red rag. Herath just stuck to his guns, landed it on middle and got it to turn away, past Kamran's mad, mad swipe. Miss. He doesn't have much time to turn back. Sanga does the rest. He didn't even turn back. Just kept walking. Good idea too. Vintage Kamran.
tossed up on leg, Misbah defends off the front foot down the track
flighted on middle and off, Misbah is cautious as he smothers the spin and defends
Misbah is away, working him away in front of square for one.
Younis leans out and drives with the spin, straight to cover
some more indecisive running. Tossed up on off, Misbah turns it square, Younis charges down, Mahela fumbles, and in the end they make the dicey single
Younis gets forward to the pitch of the delivery and punches against the spin through mid off
spit from the track for Murali, jumps up at Misbah from outside off, but he has it covered.
doosra, short of a length outside off, Misbah did not pick it and got an under edge as he tried to chop it away.
flighted and turning in, Misbah leans out and smothers the spin
ends the over with a single, delicate flick of the wrists as Murali turns another one in.
tossed up on leg, easy single for Misbah as he dabs it off the pads
Younis drives with the spin through mid off for another single
tossed up on middle and leg, Misbah again leans out and smothers the turn
the lap sweep now, as Herath lands on middle and leg, Misbah gets a couple thanks to the fumble
quicker through the air, Misbah plays back almost fatally as it hurries through, but he keeps it out
on the front foot to end the over as Herath airs it up outside off stump. Defended to the covers
tossed up on the stumps again, Murali is getting it to drift well in the air. Punched with the spin to mid on
Younis turns the strike, leans out and drives through mid off for a single
Misbah motors across to off stump line and then works Murali with the spin through wide mid on
contrasting methods for Younis, another single in the same region as he leans out and drives through wide mid on
back of a length to Misbah who defends down the track as he stays on the back foot
another single through mid on to end the over, Misbah reaches across to the pitch of the ball and works it with the flick of the wrists
back of a length on middle and off, straightening from the track, Misbah dead bats
drifting into middle and leg, Misbah taps it square, but finds the fielder
Misbah steals two with nifty running, tucks it against the spin through backward square leg and charges away as Murali runs in from the deep
he's working the field smartly, is Misbah, calmly picks up another single in front of square
on middle and leg this time, Younis stays back and works it against the spin through midwicket
ooh, quickish armer, and Younis just about kept it off the pads as he played the flick. Straight to Murali at deep backward square
the top lands back of a length and whirs in towards middle and leg, worked off the backfoot through square leg for one
Misbah picks the doosra out of Murali's hand, presents the opened face and dabs it, in this case with the spin, through point.
Younis lap-flicks from outside off to get another single through midwicket.
Misbah gets one more, chipping it with the spin, albeit uppishly, through midwicket
Murali slows it up in the air, Younis is a touch early in closing the face and plays it back down the track
sharper turn, onto the pads and Younis tucks it along to backward square leg
slants the first ball onto the pads and it is calmly tucked through square leg for a single
slow offcutter outside off, Younis hangs back and opens the face to run it down to backward point
another slow offcutter, 105.6 kph and landed back of a length. It grips and turns off the track, Misbah stays back, spots it and forces it down to long on
Younis gets one more single, easing Angelo off the pads towards midwicket
fuller and straighter, Misbah hangs back and punches towards mid on

Misbah has among the most fluid wrists in the game. And he's always looking to tickle them through the leg side. Back of a length and outside off from Angelo. Misbah trots across and chips it with minimal effort down to square leg.

and Misbah is upto his tricks again, with a compulsive reverse sweep - he's among the few players who actually plays this shot as part of his repertoire, and not as a surprise shot. Very different style too, he shuffles across, crouches down, sets up camp on off stump and then turns the grip. Comes down on the ball and controls it. As safe as any shot.
drives with the spin through long on for a single now.
soft hands from Younis, leans out to the pitch and ensures he doesn't over hit it wide of mid on. Enough time for two
nurdle, nurdle and then some more. Younis clips him off the toes through midwicket for one more

and now Misbah, almost hitting the ball to midwicket with negative momentum (for want of a better expression) as he looks to stop it around the 30 yard circle and steal a second. Mathews hurries in and keeps it to one
another single to end the over, again with the spin through midwicket. Vintage Pakistan middle overs batting. Inzy, Yousuf and Miandad would approve.
uppish flick this time, just as I was praising the batting, a lazy shot to a slower ball, almost straight to midwicket
full on middle and off, Younis punches it to long on for one more
and Misbah keeps them on their toes again, easing it from outside off with a quiet turn of the wrists, Fumble at midwicket makes the single easier

Younis steals four, Sri Lanka must be very worried now. Angelo slips the offcutter down the leg side, Younis skips inside the line and glances it really fine - he knows just where the fielders are, and the ball purrs away reluctantly to the boundary
leans back to this one and drops it towards point for another single

Misbah does his bit. Camping on the back foot, he taps it softly to Dilshan at point and takes off. Dilshan has a shy at the bowler's end, but Misbah hares across with ease. Almost ends up conceding overthrows.
tossed up on leg stump, Misbah calmly works him with the angle to midwicket
shortens the length to Younis, outside off, Younis taps to midwicket and takes another single
compact from Misbah, reaches out and smothers the spin outside off
drops the doosra in, back of a length outside off, Misbah leans back and forces it against the turn to long on for one
Younis trots a foot outside and across, gets to the turn and works him with the spin to long on. Lovely, lovely batting. This is what ODI cricket is all about.
Misbah works Murali with the spin off the pads, but this time he finds square leg
on Younis pads, he bunts it with a closed face through square leg for a single
short of a length outside off, Misbah rocks back and slaps it through the covers. Partnership of 50. Off just 60 balls.
leans out to the flight and defends down the track
the nifty armer from Herath, hurries across at Misbah who quickly adjusts and defends back down the track
he gets the single the moment Herath lands on one the pads, dabbed seamlessly through square leg
back of a length and turning away from outside off, Younis pushes into the covers
short on middle and straightening, punched without a problem wide of mid on
fuller and turning into the pads, Younis' dab goes straight to midwicket
Younis reaches out to a flighted ball outside off and looks to drop it towards point for one. No luck this time
another nudge off the pads, placed through the vacant square leg region for one
tossed up on middle, Misbah drives with the spin to long on for one more
Murali lands this a foot outside off and Younis drives inside out, can't quite time the shot but he gets a single to deep cover
flat and quick on middle and leg, Younis plays it back to the bowler
lands this outside leg and straightens, Younis works it square. One more
Misbah is walking all around the crease now, walks away to the leg side and then comes back closer. Herath just fires it in full and he digs it out
slower through the air, and on leg stump, Misbah flicks easily through midwicket for one
Younis chips him against the spin, from the line of middle and off towards mid on for a single

that patent Misbah reverse paddle again, this time Murali at short third man saw him set up base on off stump and started moving. As a result he cut the angle and fielded the shot, very well executed as it was, from outside off stump
bangs it in back of a length, stays back and steers it through the off side
fuller this time, but no movement yet, Misbah reaches forward and defends into the covers
driven solidly down the ground for one to long on. A hint of inward tail for Thisara, but not enough to trouble Misbah, obdurate as a rock at the moment.
back of a length outside Younis' off stump, he defends into the covers

not the first time Thisara has speared one down the leg side, and Younis is in too good form to let that go. An air of inevitability to it, the moment it left Thisara's hands. Younis was always inside the line, he was always going to whip it and he ensured the wrists turned well enough to beat the man at deep square leg.
Younis punches the last ball solidly down the ground. Pakistan hold all the aces going into the second drinks break.
gets one on the pads, and spirits it down to long on
tucks him up with one that angles in, and he pats it back down the track
now he moves away from leg stump, and plays an inside out drive to long off
cannot beat the bowler in his attempt to ping long off with the drive
this time he does, gets a tossed up one, and drives with the turn to wide long off
the Misbah way of milking the bowling, stands a foot outside leg, sees the ball fired in, plays beside the front pad and tucks it away through square leg
dead straight on middle, from short of a length, he pushes it out to point with an open face, but that's about it
positive from Misbah, gets a wide one and slashes it away down to third man
another one bang on middle stump, Younis goes behind it and plays it down softly on the leg side
Thisara gets one to bounce extra, and Younis rides it to cut it away to point, without any sort of power too
now he gets some room outside off, and it is too short, punched away to sweeper cover off the back foot

run out missed, Misbah had done the one-step dance before the ball came, but it was on target near the blockhole, he nevertheless got it towards midwicket, Younis was slow to get off, and if the throw had hit, he would have been running back to the pavilion
again Misbah stands miles outside leg, gets a shortish and slower one and slaps it away to sweeper cover
way down the pads, and helped away by Younis, who goes down on a knee and finds deep square leg
brings bat in front of pad and defends a tossed up delivery
super running, and neat placement, he picked the ball from off stump, flicked it past the square leg umpire, and they came back comfortably for the second

oops, the bowler beats the batsman, and Sanga too, this one went straight on, Misbah was flicking from outside the line, and played around it, Sanga missed the take as well, Murali stops it just inside the ropes with his foot, given as runs, hmm
goes across, waits for this shortish one to turn a little, and whacks it down to long off for a single
gets the front foot across, then brings down the bat quickly to send a length ball  in front of square leg
stands miles outside leg again, and gets one that is miles outside off, but gets bat to it, and cuts it away to sweeper cover
plays a back of a length ball in to the off side
now he launches in to the pull, are Pakistan breaking free now, it was short and he pulled it over midwicket and in to the gap
the slower bouncer, almost did Younis in, he was halfway in to the pull, before he had to adjust hastily, and swatted it in front of square leg in the end
Misbah the nurdler turns up now, it is a slower length ball on leg stump, he goes way outside the line, and tickles it past a diving Sanga, the ball is stopped near the boundary
gives him a half-charge, stops in his tracks, and then nurdles the full delivery in to the leg side
goes down for the sweep, and gets an under edge fine past Sanga, Misbah wanted three, Younis didn't
he doesn't need to run for those, super shot, made room outside leg, and lifted the delivery over extra cover and into the gap for a boundary, the 200 comes up now
flicked wide of midwicket this time, runs, runs, all around, Sri Lanka can;t plug the gaps
tickled to short fine leg for a single
stays in the crease, and tries to steal a single towards square leg, but Sanga is alert and runs across to field
full on the leg stump, swept fiercely backward of deep square leg
again he strays down the leg side, this time it's a wide
bowls one outside off this time, but Misbah is ready with the sweep, and short third man had to dive to his left to cut off the runs
smoothly driven down the ground wide of long on, and they take the second as well, boy the statesmen are turning it on
sweeps from outside off, and in front of square leg this time, the man is there doing quite some running
Misbah dead bats in forward defence, just kills whatever spin the ball had
stays in the crease, and late cuts a delivery that turns in from outside off, but right to short third man, missed out there
a touch short, and he rocks back and hammers it through midwicket
even better, Misbah gets to his 50 with a shimmie down the track, and a drive wide of midwicket
ooh, he barely got away with this one, it was much fuller than he thought, he wanted to go over extra cover, but checked his shot and just  managed to hit it back to the bowler in the end
now he charges down the track, almost in Kamran fashion, and gets an inside edge towards midwicket

Younis departs, well someone had to go for it now, he went for the sweep, got a top-edge that looped up tamely in the air for a catch to short fine leg, Herath has justified his selection ahead of Ajantha, Younis has set up a late charge from Pakistan

yikes, he goes for a reverse sweep first ball, it was going straight on with the arm, he had decided to reverse sweep no matter what, it came off the glove, and hit him on the arm, then on the helmet grill, Sanga thinks it was pad, and Sri Lanka go for the review, and replays confirm the obvious, Umar stays on
bowls one on a length outside off stump, and Misbah under edges it close to the stumps on the off side
a push down to long on, beats Kula and that means a single is on, easily
gets a full toss, and clatters it through to sweeper cover, lots of intent there, of the aggressive kind
brings out the full-blooded drive to a full delivery, but short extra cover is lurking around
goes for an awkward pull to a short one around off stump, gets an edge on to the leg side
he does a reverse Misbah, stands two feet outside off, jumps two steps down the track, and late cuts a length delivery, but third man runs across to cut it off
slapped away wide of sweeper cover, it was short and sitting up, and he gave it a nice old whack
the slower one, he does not pick it, and bottom edges the cut towards point
short delivery outside off, guided away to third man
slower one in the blockhole, nothing he could do with it, was surprised and pushed it back to the bowler
this is superb bowling from Mathews, it was a slow bouncer, he tried to get around it, and cut it over point, but there was no pace at all to work with
he creates some momentum now on his own, comes down the pitch, takes it on the full and bunts it past a hapless mid off
lovely stuff from the great man, tossed up, inviting the extra cover drive, Umar goes for it and is beaten, how did that miss off stump?
sharp turn from well outside off, he goes down the leg side, and cuts it in front of cover
too much turn to do anything with it, Misbah blocks it back to Murali
turns it right on middle stump, he goes deep in the crease, but even then, there is no room to work it away
now he gets it away finally, flicks one away through square leg
superb bowling, what an over, tossed up and coming in, he takes two steps towards the ball, but can only block it
starts off with one full and cramping a backing-away-outside-leg batsman, who drives it down to long on
super stuff all around, Umar made room and thrashed away a full delivery to mid off, who picked it up in a flash, and threw at the non-striker's, but missed, fortunately for Umar
goes deep in the crease, creates the length to swing his arms, and does so powerfully, hitting it over midwicket and into the gap for a boundary
in the blockhole, squeezed out to point
backs away looking to go over the off side infield, Kula bowls it full outside off and he tries to squeeze it away, but is beaten

Kula messes it off the last delivery of the over, it was a full toss, and he smashed it away wide of extra cover, he was itching for that shot, and when he saw the full toss, needed no more invitation
flicked in the air down to long on for a single
this is excellent stuff from Murali, cramps him for room with a turning one on middle stump, he dances around in the crease, but in the end blocks it

Umar goes, it was short, a rare one from Murali, in his eagerness to capitalise on the scarce offering, he pulled it in the air, got in a awkward position as he went through with the shot, and Dilshan took  sharp diving chance at deep midwicket, Murali has suffocated Pakistan in the Powerplay
whipped away off the pads through square leg, brings boom boom Afridi on strike
Afridi wants to go over deep square leg first ball, but is beaten as he sweeps too soon
turns it sharply but down the leg side
Murali, what a spell, gets Afridi to defend in the powerplay, tossed up and turning in, Shahid comes forward and blocks
Kula follows Misbah as he goes down the leg side, it is full and in the blockhole, pushed back to the bowler
does not get hold of this length delivery, as he looks to heave it down the ground, it goes towards long on
lovely bowling, Afridi hits a yorker straight back to the bowler
Sri Lanka are all over Pakistan in the powerplay, Afridi digs out another yorker back to the bowler
three dot balls to Afridi in the powerplay, Kula takem a bow, Afridi backs away down leg, Kula goes full outside off, Shahid misses
Afridi gets one away this time, Kula went for the yorker again, but it did not come out right, and Afridi muscles it wide of long on and in to the boundary
starts off with a full toss, and Misbah shuffles across the stumps, and flicks it past square leg, can Pakistan make good use of the final powerplay over?
gets one in the blockhole, he charges down he track, and bunts it down to long on
Afridi gets one that is a touch short, and launches it away up and over extra cover, it was a slower one, he stayed in the crease, and bashed it over the in field
if that had connected, if Afridi had connected with that one, they would have had to find a new ball, he threw everything at this full delivery , but could not connect
biff, it was in the blockhole, but makes no difference to Afridi, he goes down on a knee and hammers it through extra cover, violence, useful violence
another full one, this time he goes straight down the ground, it flew off the bat, but some brilliant fielding near the ropes saves a couple
gets a full toss, it says hit me from around leg stump, and Misbah swings it cleanly, and it almost carries all the way over the deep square leg boundary
good delivery, it was angled full across the batsman, who was surprised with the angle, Sanga gathers
another full delivery, hit down the ground to long on
goes wide of midwicket, and collects some more runs
backs away and goes for the upper cut to a short and wide delivery, but cannot get it over Dilshan at point, who goes high at it with outstretched hands, and pouches it cleanly
fires it across Razzaq, it was wide outside off stump, but not called so
goes for the scoop over fine leg from outside off, gets an edge that scoots away towards third man
gets a full delivery, goes down on a knee and carves it wide of long off
sprays it very wide of off stump, this time it is called one
the yorker arrives now, outside off stump, and he digs it out in to the off side
Misbah, you beauty, moves outside off stump, and flicks a full delivery off his toes, and wide of square leg, calm and calculated hitting
stays in the crease, and biffs a full ball down to long on

high full toss, Razzaq had to go for maximum, and did so, but his swing produced a top edge that swirled high in the air and settled in the hands of extra cover, Sri Lanka will feel that they have restrained a Pakistan line-up that threatened to gallop away, but couldn't quite do so

inn2.comm: back of a length on middle at 143 kph. Shoaib is chugging away already. Tharanga hangs back and defends from the crease as it angles across
width outside off this time, Tharanga opens the face and steers it away to third man

141 kph, back of a length outside off and Dilshan has a wild monster swing at it, without moving anything. That came in off the seam. Dilshan practices the textbook cover drive after missing. What a guy!
on his pads, Dilshan can't get bat on the flick and it runs off the pads towards square leg for a leg bye
beaten by pace and movement. 141 kph as it angles across Tharanga who feels for it with feet rooted. Missed the ball by a mile.
and he mistimes a drive to the leg side off the last ball. Nice bustling over from Shoaib, ends with one more angling across, back of a length and he gets an inside edge towards midwicket
back of a length outside off, Dilshan defends from the crease, calmly down the track
128 kph, length ball on middle and leg, Dilshan wants more pace on the ball as he looks for a huge on-drive. Played onto the toe.
keeps it back of a length again, Dilshan on-drives with more control to mid on
short ball, Razzaq's pack of pace - high 120s - lets him off as Dilshan just can't time the pull well enough
shade of away nip from outside off, Dilshan's feet aren't moving yet as he pokes at it and gets it to point
maiden for Razzaq as Dilshan ends the over the way he began it, with a docile defensive push to the off side

pace, pure pace. That clocked at 141 kph, but I am sure it came off the track at much greater speed. Short ball, hustles Tharanga onto the back foot where he dangles the bat, horizontal and in hope as the ball whizzes by, it cracks the outside edge, flies high and nearly carries over third man.
more assurance from Tharanga, leans into a check drive into the covers as Shoaib lands it fuller
Tharanga controls the steer this time, Shoaib again drops short, he rides the bounce and angles it backward of point for one
Dilshan's not finding this easy yet. Shoaib angles into middle and leg, he looks to whip-hoick behind square but can't make connection

whoa, Dilshan smashes a cover drive with great vengeance and furious anger (As Samuel Jackson says, in Pulp Fiction), and it bursts through Afridi. They take a single and Afridi is wringing his hands in pain after returning the throw
length ball on off stump, Tharanga gets into a nice position as he eases the cover drive, and finds the fielder
Dilshan beaten outside the off by a Razzaq typical legcutter that just nips away a shade from back of a length. Ambitious shot from Dilshan, no feet and just hitting on the up, and he misses
Razzaq is bowling real well here, another one on the spot outside off, McGrath would approve. Dilshan just defends to the off side
hmm, thick edge now as he looks to force the upper cut away, though Razzaq's not giving him any room. If he timed it any better, he'd have holed out to third man

Tharanga is away with a fine shot. Back of a length again from Razzaq, probably six inches further up than he should have been. That was enough for Tharanga to move forward and drive through the line. Lovely touch.
fuller this time, Tharanga probably taken by surprise by the fuller length, digs it out into the covers
normal service resumes, back of a length outside off and Tharanga hangs back to steer it straight to point
Shoaib pumps it in, back of a length and targeting Dilshan's body, he calmly taps it to square leg for one
short of a length and just outside off, too close for the cut and not short enough either. Tharanga gets a bottom edge away to the slips. Good start this, from Pakistan.
slow offcutter from Shoaib - at 130 kph. Yes, I know thats faster than many fast bowlers' fastest balls, but well. Tharanga stays on the crease and drops it to the off side
fuller, and on the stumps, he drives it with the full face straight to mid off
another slower ball at 126 kph. Praveen Kumar, are you watching? Tharanga opens the face and dabs it to third man for a single this time
145 kph, saved by Shoaib's pace! Dilshan looks to flick and gets a leading edge that balloons up over point and to third man for a single
length ball angling into Dilshan who drives without much fluency to mid on

at long last, Dilshan times one of 'em on-the-up thumps through the covers. Again back of a length from Razzaq, and Dilshan goes through the line. Not much movement this time and he gets it off the middle

edged, but there are no slips in place to take it. Dilshan releases the pressure with two fours in two balls, again stays rooted on leg stump and looks to flail at one back of a length outside off. Thick edge, flies away in a hurry.
Razzaq sticks to his tight lines on off stump, Dilshan can't time the forceful punch off the back foot and finds cover
legcutter on middle and off, Dilshan opens the face and runs it down to third man for a single

ahh, Pakistan. Tharanga is let off, he should have been run out by two yards. On a length on middle stump, Tharanga turns it away to square leg and takes off. Mistake. The throw comes in, not the best, and it is not collected. Tharanga huffs in for the last couple of yards and makes his ground
back of a length outside off, Tharanga hangs back and steers to backward point
slow offcutter, 126 kph and outside leg before gripping and turning into the pads. Tharanga deflects it behind square for a single
short of a length outside off, this time Shoaib tries to punch on the up and finds cover
ah, bouncer at 143 kph, but it seemed to come slowly off the track as Dilshan tried to sway away and upper-cut. He couldn't get it away though.
this is real good bowling. 145 kph, and a McGrathesque length. No way he can get it away, Dilshan stays on leg stump and tries to force it through point, but finds the fielder
short ball, wider outside off and he looks to cut, but gets an under edge away to third man. Jittery start this for Sri Lanka.
Dilshan can't time a ball for the world today. Gul sprays the first one on the pads and he looks to hoick it behind square. Doesn't make contact and it thuds into the pads.
another wild swing. Rameez Raja says Dilshan's looking like a tail-ender. I think that's a little uncharitable. Back of a length outside off, flails away violently and misses.
gets bat on the ball this time, cracks a cut away straight to point
fuller length this time from Gul, Dilshan looks to drive on the up. Timing is again conspicuous by its absence. Played so feebly that he gets a single despite playing straight to mid off
138 kph, short ball hustles Tharanga into the late steer and he's hoplessly late on the shot
ends the over with a quiet dab to point as Gul gives him no room outside off, played straight to point.
seamless shift from pace to seam for Shoaib, leaves Dilshan looking sheepish as it darts away from middle stump line, past his flat-footed swish
short of a length, coming into Dilshan who mistimes the pull since he is beaten for pace. Edged and away for one to midwicket
fuller length on leg stump, at 141 kph, Tharangs check drives to mid on
he gets the single away, playing back to a delivery on a length outside off, goes away off the inside edge to mid on for one
that's a slice of life for Dilshan. Short ball, just outside off, he again looks for a whole-hearted carve and it flies away well over the solitary slip and down to third man
short length again, comes into the batsman and Dilshan looks to whip it square and misses
full length ball on leg stump, it is squeezed away to mid on for a single
Gul hits the deck hard as he always does, angling into the pads and Dilshan somehow gets a single away to square leg
Tharanga is looking the better batsman out there, though it is not saying much. Short ball from Gul, angles across Tharanga who arches back and makes room to crack a cut through point.

whoa, where did that bounce from? 135 kph and a foot short of a length, Tharanga was looking to steer the ball to third man, but the ball missed his bat my half a foot as it reared up like the Loch Ness. Kamran did well to leap up and collect it
Tharanga gets it away for one, stays back in the crease and opens the face to steer a single this time as Gul lands it fuller outside off.
length ball at 139 to end the over, Dilshan hits it so hard on the up, but can't time the shot. Straight to mid on
slides the first one down the leg side, called a wide
tossed up slowly outside off, Tharanga opens the face and steers to point
straighter and fuller, Tharanga drives to short cover
holds the length back, Tharanga again gets half forward and defends
low bounce outside off, Tharanga tries to force the cut and misses
another wide, this time down the leg side and is called
sharp turn for Hafeez from off stump, Tharanga opens the face and adjusts to get it away to point
ah, he's spoilt the over with a half-tracker. Tharanga cashes in, rocking back and rifling another cut behind point for a single.

timing, Dilshan's long forgotten friend, makes a late appearance. Not too late really. Short ball from Gul, Dilshan hangs back, sets himself up beside the ball and cracks it away viciously. The man sweeping at deep backward point had no chance.
fuller delivery, coming into leg stump, Dilshan punches straight to mid on
tight line just outside off, Dilshan tries to force it off the back foot and finds point
another upper, the shot is working well for Dilshan today. Gul is looking to hassle him with bounce, but he can't keep Dilshan quiet, he stays under the ball and redirects it to third man.
well, Pakistan need a wicket. No-balls don't help. Plays it out to mid off, and retains strike for the free hit. Here we go ....
Umar Gul may want to discover a chemical element, but he's not in his element today. Yet. Short ball, wide well over Dilshan's head and away to the boundary
finally he gets the free hit out of the way, full and a foot wide outside off, Dilshan squeezes it out square for a single
Pakistan have bled in this over. Back of a length outside off, and Dilshan forces it away square for a couple
Is that Hafeez or Murali? Spins away like a fiend from outside off, sliding past the forward defensive. Good delivery
this one goes the other way, Tharanga gets an inside edge away to short fine leg
armer from Hafeez, Tharanga tries his hand at cutting against the spin but can't get it away
another Hafeez over ruined by a late boundary. Good hit from Tharanga. Not a bad ball, full length on middle and leg, Tharanga just tees off like Ernie Els would, clean and over mid on for four
straighter one again, comes in off the track and Tharanga defends down the track
and another dot ball to end the over, short of a length and turning away, played away into the off side
full length on off stump, Dilshan can't get it away. Played back down the track as he looks to make room and drive
short ball, Dilshan's finally getting the pull shots away, rolls the wrists over it and pings deep midwicket for a couple
short of a length and cutting in, Dilshan stays back and forces it through long on for one more
back of a length outside the off stump, Tharanga plays it off the back foot into the covers
offcutter on the pads, Tharanga can't get the flick away and quietly pats it to midwicket for one
mowed away, short ball sitting up and he under-edges a single to deep backward square leg

Hafeez in the Powerplays is not working. Three fours in three overs. Short ball, just outside off, there are men patrolling the infield on the off side, but Tharanga has no problem cracking it away past all of them for four

well, I take that back. Hafeez has nailed Tharanga. As mentioned earlier, there is an army of green shirts inside the circle on the off side. Tossed up outside on leg, Tharanga drives on the up, and picks out Afridi at mid-off. He's thrilled after pouching the catch, tumbling forward. The game is back in the balance after Sri Lanka's recovery of sorts.
and is away with a tuck off the pads in front of midwicket
this one comes in on Dilshan, who stays back and blocks in to the off side
gets well forward and plays the forward defensive, some turn for Hafeez
played out in to the off side, and Dilshan will retain strike
harmless short of a length ball on the pads, tucked away in front of square leg
Sanga leans forward into an attempted drive past the bowler, Razzaq picks it up and threatens to throw it back
twirled away off the hips in front of square leg, it was short of a length but Razzaq strayed down the leg side
Afridi lets one go through his hands at short extra cover, but mid off was alert enough to cut off the confident drive from Dilshan
Sanga with the tap to cover, and takes off for the single, could have been tight had the throw hit at the non-striker's end
Dilshan with the cut to backward point, it straightened after pitching short of a length around middle, and Dilshan had a long look at it, but missed out in the end
eased away through the covers off the front foot
cut away off the back foot, it was turning in sharply on middle, but Dilshan was quick on the shot, and came back for the second
this one kept low, and Dilshan was beaten as he again attempted to cut
wayward one down the leg side, and Dilshan helps it on its way fine, short fine leg does well to get a hand to it and take some pace off the shot
ooh, almost carried to short extra cover, Sanga was pushing forward early outside off stump
pushed back down the track, it was much fuller this time, and on the leg stump
he is welcomed with a front foot slap wide of sweeper cover by Dilshan, just plonks the front foot out and gives it a fearful tonk
pushed behind point off the back foot

boom booom strikes, it was too close for the cut, it was the one that went straight on, it was the one that kept low too, a deadly combination for Dilshan, who still went for the shot, and dinked it on to his stumps, Afridi stands mid-pitch with arms outstretched, has Pakistan's saviour arrived?
this one is tossed up around middle, Mahela eases it back to Afridi
pushed towards mid on off the front foot, Mahela taking it easy upfront
short fine leg is extremely fine indeed, and cuts off a pull by Mahela who gave the treatment to a short one going down the pads, but could not beat the fielder
pitching outside leg and striking Sanga on the pads, trickles away in front of cover, Shoaib goes theatrical in a vain appeal
calmly punched away off the back foot, and they trot a single as the ball goes to sweeper cover
tentatively pushes this length delivery back towards Shoaib, it bounced more than he expected and he was already well forward
angling across the batsman from back of a length, Sanga rides the bounce to bring it down
Sanga flicks elegantly off the pads, in the air too, there is no one at square leg, but there is a man in the deep
off the bottom edge as Mahela looks to punch through point
worked away off the pads behind square leg
good loopy delivery, he is forward and pushes in the air but short extra cover was not short enough
gets forward and drives but short extra cover tumbles to his right to stop the ball
short and going straight on, pulled away backward of square
full on the pads, he drives it to midwicket
the one that goes across the left-hander, he goes back and cuts wide of sweeper cover, who does well to get to it in the end
Mahela had a close look at this slow and short one wide outside off, thought about upper cutting it for a moment, and then backed out of the shot

the Rawalpindi Express is chugging in at full steam, and has broken through the defences of Mahela, lovely delivery, pacy, on a length and cutting in, Mahela drove outside the line, and the middle stump was pegged back, Shoaib first does the aeroplane thing, then points to himself as if to say 'I told you'
Shoaib is steaming in, and the extra effort gets extra bounce, thilan leaves outside off
this time he has to play at it, short of a length and in to the body, he gets an inside edge in front of square leg, Shoaib grimaces
goes across Sanga with one that cuts further away off the seam, he stays in the crease and plays it out to point
the Shoaib slower one, at er, 128.8 kph, bounces high, Sanga does not pick the lack of pace and keeps it down towards point in the end
goes straight on, he goes back, and pushes it out hurriedly to point

Shahid does the rope trick on Thilan, flights this one on middle, gets Thilan forward, and out of the crease, gets the ball to turn as well, Kamran does not mess up the take behind the stumps, in fact Thilan's foot is just out of the crease when Kamran takes off the bails, Shahid Afridi is one short of 300 ODI wickets
hurries on to the batsman from a length close to off stump, he gets bat to ball in the end
goes in the air on the leg side as he pushes at it, Afridi asks the question half-heartedly
flicked away off the pads, Afridi went full on the leg stump to Sanga
lovely slow turning leg break, right forward in defence is Silva
Sanga is down, but he is not out, he had pushed this one towards cover and taken off, before being sent back belatedly, but the wayward throw was never going to hit the stumps
Sanga gets a welcome boundary, waits for a length delivery to arrive outside off, and times it past point, nothing else, just pure timing
digs one in short, Sanga waits in the crease and hits it to sweeper cover
goes for the drive to a length delivery around off stump, gets an inside edge that goes to mid on
whips this length delivery around middle wristily wide of mid on, was a bit late on the shot, but got bat to ball in the end
pushed in front of midwicket, they both converge towards the center of the wicket, but then retreat to their respective safeties
eased down to long on for a single
Sanga pushes forward and defends a quicker one
more flight this time, Sanga continues with the forward press
pushes forward again, this time with an angled bat that takes the ball to point and gives Sanga a run
too full on the middle and leg line, pushed down to mid on
good and quick over from Shahid, Silva comes forward to push a flatter one in to the off side
flighted delivery from over the wicket pushed down wide of long off
gets an inside edge backward of square leg as he pushes half-forward
whoops, this one kicks up nastily from a length, Sanga is surprised and takes it on the body
played with the turn towards midwicket, cautious defence from Sanga
this time he pushes in front of cover and collects an easy single
flat and short, punched away without any power to short extra cover
guided to the left of point for a single
turning away from off stump, played out towards midwicket off the back foot
the googly, comes in, but it is short, so he can go back and cut it away to point
Afridi is getting ti to bite, turn and bounce, Silva keeps it down in to the off side
defended off the front foot
super bowling from the captain, flat and arrives quickly outside off, he can only defend
shows the full face of the blade and pushes one from off stump down to long on
dabs this one with the turn late to short third man, some bounce there for Rehman

Rehman strikes now, or does he, and Sri Lanka slip further, or do they, he went for the sweep to a full delivery, missed and was hit on the pads, they all went up in appeal, umpire Harper thought that was out, but Sri Lanka go for the appeal, and replays show the ball would have hit the fourth stump, Silva lives on
connects with the sweep this time, and sends it backward of square leg
Sanga is watchfully forward in defence, looks to go for the single, but Kamran sprints towards the ball, and cuts off such thoughts
full delivery played out towards midwicket
goes straight with the arm, and goes down leg too
chops one close to the stumps, it was very too close for the cut, but he went for it anyways
driven neatly to long off for a single
Sanga eases a fuller one past a diving backward point who takes pace off the shot
more bounce for Afridi, so even if it was short enough for the cut, Silva could hit it only to cover
defended off the front foot
pinches a single in front of square as Afridi goes on the pads
cut away off the back foot to short third man
quicker one, played out in front of cover, nothing's happening for Sri Lanka
tossed up a little, defended off the front foot, generous turn for Rehman
cut away behind point where the fielder pulls off a diving stop
the faster one that goes straight on, almost caught him by surprise, but he got bat down on ball in time
gets an inside edge as he goes forward in defence, Kamran cuts off the single, the asking rate mounts further
the Gul length, short of a good one, on the pads, and Sanga tucks it away to fine leg
oops, he gets out of the line of a shortish delivery that does not get up that much, it was far away from off too, pressure
he will be better off leaving, this time he goes fishing outside off, Gul gets it to zip away, and beats the outside edge
Silva finally gets one away wide of midwicket, he comes back for the second, Sanga takes on the throw, which misses, Pakistan have been totally off target on that aspect today
Silva is thoroughly tied down here, plays out another short of a length ball to point
gets to the pitch and drives now, but it goes straight to mid off, the gaps seem to have evaporated, there are men in dark green everywhere

Kamran fluffs a stumping, all is well with the world, Rehman beat Sanga with some flight, and angling it down the leg side, he got some extra bounce again, which beat Kamran totally, Sanga was in no position to get back
played out to midwicket off the back foot
gets this one past midwicket for a single, that is all they are getting as of now, in meagre trickles
Silva shows some belated urgency, comes down the track and picks up a single to long off
gets outside the line, uses the turn down the pads to work it away to square leg
Silva dances down the pitch once more, and gets the single down to long off
good delivery to end the over, turning in on off stump, Sanga plays it back to REhman
Silva has gone into an absolute shell, plays out a short of a length ball to point
even when he eases in to a free-flowing drive, it goes straight to point, boy, Silva is really hurting the chase here
tries to tap this one, but pushes hard at it, and it goes to cover quickly
finally a single, off the fourth ball of the over, Silva's drive goes past cover, this is a good comeback from Gul
Sanga walks across and whips a length ball down to fine leg, brings Silva back on strike
tucks him up with a fuller one, lovely bowling from Gul, Silva pushes it out to the right of Gul who rushes to collect it
tossed up on off, Sanga reaches out and defends to mid off
short ball turning away, Sanga hangs back and cracks it to deep point for one
sliding onto Silva's pads, he tucks it square and runs across for one
on Sanga's pads, nurdled round the corner to backward square leg
flighted on middle, Silva sets himself up early for the sweep and gets it away to deep square leg for one
lively stuff from Shehzad at point. Short ball turning away, Sanga cuts and thinks of a single, but Shehzad dives, collects as he tumbles, and releases the throw as he rolls over. Real good stuff.
short ball, slants onto the hips and Silva works it to the short fine leg fielder for one
back of a length and tight line on Sanga's off stump, he can't middle the check drive and gets a single off the inside edge to point

Chamara misses out on a gift and is nearly run out to boot. Full toss on leg stump, the yorker gone wrong, Chamara times the flick perfectly but hits straight to Rehman at midwicket. He has a shy and misses. Gul running back to the stumps can't collect either.
full delivery, angling across Sanga who mistimes the expansive off drive, but picks a single
Gul keeps Silva guessing with the lengths, this time 140 kph and hitting the deck at a lively pace outside off, Chamara just about manages to get it away backward of square for one
Gul begins with a perfect over, back of a length outside off, Sanga forces it into the covers and steals a tight single. Silva again has to huff and puff to his end.
speared into the pads, Sanga punches to mid on.
finally some intent in the Powerplay, and it nearly costs Sanga his wicket as he chips out and flicks in the air, and nearly holes out to deep midwicket
Silva continues to struggle from cannot-time-it-itis. He jumps out and looks to hoick across the line, and misses the ball completely. Thuds into the pads and there's a lbw appeal
opens the face and dabs towards point for a single
Sanga opens the face and carves over point for a couple.

Kamran, oh Kamran. Another fluffed stumping. Same as before, Sanga jumps out a mile looking to flick. Rehman sees him and fires it wide, Sanga misses and is halfway down the track. Kamran whips the bails off. Find the missing link - yes, Kamran did not collect. I now know the only weak link in Pakistan's side. It is behind the stumps.
fuel to fire. Insult to injury. All of that. Slides down the leg side again, Sanga works it along to fine leg for four.
Silva stays on the crease and plays back down the track

another drop! What's happening Pakistan? Are they trying to keep Silva in there? Even he seems keen to get out! Short ball from Gul, Silva was hopelessly away from having it under control as he went for the pull. Makes shambolic connection and it flies up for a dolly to Rehman at midwicket, who spills it. Ouch.
Sanga looks to work a single, but gets it on the pads and then steals a leg bye
full on off stump, flicked powerfully to mid off for a single

Is that Sanga? Is that Jayasuriya? The first six of the innings. The tide is thinking hard about turning here. Sanga backs away. Gul sees him. Sanga opens up the off side. Gul sees him. He angles it across Sanga short of a length and challenges him to go over the off side. Sanga does, and in some style. Crack! The ball flies all the way over third man as Sanga uppercuts. Tony Greig on air goes bonkers in his inimitable style. Well, well.
Sanga backs away again, this time Gul follows him, and he plays a cramped pull to Afridi at midwicket. He runs like a fiend to complete the single
fired in full on leg stump, Sanga drives it hard down to long off for one
Silva skips out again, Rehman sees him and fires it in short of a length, Silva swipes across the line and gets a single to square leg
Sanga moves away to leg stump and forces a mistimed pull to square leg for one
over-pitched on leg stump, Silva tamely plays it back to the bowler
short ball outside off, completely mistimes the pull to midwicket. Another single
Sanga backs away to the 17th stump, Rehman follows him full and fast, Sanga flicks it despite not having room. Oho, Rehman has over-stepped.
full toss on leg stump, he just can't time them today. Swings it high to deep square leg, couple of bounces to the man patrolling the deep.

Afridi reviews an lbw decision turned down by Umpire Gould. Short ball, Sanga goes for the pull and misses. What a shocker of a review! That landed two miles outside leg stump. And hit him on the top flap of the pad. Might have been not out on height. Certainly not out for line. George Binoy says thats the worst review he has ever seen. I have seen worse, for third rate Bollywood movies.
another one wide outside leg stump, Sanga looks to heave and miss? Will Afridi review it? Not this time.
finally Sanga connects with the sweep, Umar Gul does the good old skate along the tummy as he puts in a really amazing diving effort at deep midwicket. Keeps him down to two.

Captain strikes. Captain falls. How much of a contribution did Gul have to this dismissal? Sanga skips out of the crease. Afridi sees him and drops it short outside off. Sanga still wants to go over the top, so stops his initial shot and tries to cross-bat it over long on. Too ambitious. Shehzad runs in, tumbles forward and pouches. Finally someone doesn't let a stumping or a catch go.
Silva works one with an angled face to point. Shambolic calling, but no run out this time
Chamara plays all around a delivery homing in on off stump. Sri Lanka are sinking
tossed up on off, driven solidly to long on for one
tossed up on off, leans into the cover drive after skipping out and gets it away for one
extra spin for Rehman, gets this to land on middle and off and break away sharply, past the outside edge

ha, Kamran collects one and is so gleeful, he's appealed for it. Turned down and reviewed by Pakistan. Lovely turn from Rehman again, lands this outside off, turns away from Mathews who is squared up and it goes close to the outside edge. Can't say from the replay if he edged it. The way Kamran went up, he must have been 100% sure. But then, he is Kamran. Well, if this was an edge - and there's no way we can confirm it - then its a slur on the UDRS. Pakistan have been penalised a review for what actually may have been out. They are out of reviews now.
back of a length outside off, dropped to cover for a single
this one's sliding down the leg side and is worked along the way for a single

run out chance but Silva escapes. Mathews dinks Afridi from leg stump line to the leg side and starts, but he was never serious about the single. Silva ran half way down and then turned back as Kamran ran across, collected and had a go. He missed, and Silva made it despite sliding
fuller outside off, Mathews leans into the drive and gets one into the covers
shorter ball outside off, Silva cuts it away square for one.
aha, this hurries through, Mathews pkays for legspin and nearly chops it onto the stumps.
hurtling in towards the stumps, Chamara is miles away from spotting the quicker one and goes for an ambitious cut. Lucky to get bat on it
comes in with the angle, swept along the way for one to the deep.
full delivery outside off, he goes for the cut and finds point.

another run out chance missed. It's not even an event anymore. Silva chops straight to Shehzad, Mathews hares down, Silva responds late, Shehzad collects and throws at the bowler's end. And misses. The bowler is not there to collect and Silva tumbles in.
Mathews runs out of the crease and looks to carve through the off side, can't time it
bunts a straight ball from off stump to the leg side and gets a single
quicker one, searching for the lbw, but Silva is truly un-outable today. He gets a single to mid-on
Mathews opens the face and dabs towards point with the spin for another single

a rare boundary for Sri Lanka. And it comes through good fortune. Angelo charges out and throws the bat at a flighted ball outside off. It turns away and takes the outside edge to run away for four through third man
what a response, quicker one on the spot outside off, Mathews nearly edges it as he looks to dab to the off side
and a slower one looped up this time, Mathews goes for a reverse sweep and misses
Mathews gets a single this time, forcing a full ball down to long on

Silva you legend! Can't time the ball off the square, he's struggling to throw his bat at everything, so what does he do? He actually throws the bat away! Goes for a sweep, the ball goes nowhere, the bat is headed for Harper at square leg, who ducks. Must be sweaty out there.
Mathews taps with the spin through backward point for one
on Angelo's pads, he works it square for a single. Over to Silva, who is playing the longest innings by a SL player without hitting a boundary. The opposite of a blinder. An eye-opener.
who said he can't hit a boundary. Rehman looks very disappointed it comes against him, as Silva goes ddown on a knee and slams a sweep over short fine leg
Silva is on a late roll here. Two fours in two balls. Rehman angles this on down the leg side again and Silva slaps it along to fine leg for four more
and he nearly holes out as Rehman redirects the line to outside off. Silva is ready for the pre-meditated sweep and nearly picks out Gul at deep backward square leg
Mathews tries to steal a single backward of point, but finds the fielder

aha, is this game turning again? Three fours in that over. Mathews times the slog sweep powerfully as Rehman messes up his line and length big time. Short ball on the stumps, no bounce or turn. Sat up and asked to be hit, Mathews did the needful.
Mathews looks to steer Afridi backward of point, and gets a single away
Turns away from outside off, Silva opens the face and uses Afridi's pace to power the ball along to third man fence. Purple patch - three fours in four balls
Silva gets a single, he's worked this square off the pads to the leg side

Angelo is gone. Afridi has four. Shehzad has another catch. Angelo skips out of the crease, and Afridi sees him. He holds the length back and gets it to turn away. Angelo is forced to go with the shot and tries to cross-bat swipe it over long off. Mistimed, and it carries straight to Shehzad. Almost cleared the ropes, but not quite.
tossed up on leg stump, Perera flicks it square for a single
Silva can't get bat on ball, but he gets pad on it. Leg bye
wide slips down the leg side, Gul misses the yorker
Chamara has found a lease of timing from no where. He's managed to set himself up for a pull and time Gul's short ball wide of deep square leg for four
the yorker misses its mark by not much. Silva looks to whack it to the leg side and barely gets an inside edge to short fine leg for a single
Thisara gets a short ball angling across, and was backing away to look for the leg side boundary. He ended up too far away from the ball to make good contact, swung and missed
another short ball, Thisara wants a piece of the midwicket boundary. Can't time this swipe pull too well, he finds midwicket
over-pitched on leg stump, Silva has a fifty, has he redeemed this? Not by a distance. Driven straight to mid on.

that's Thisara power for you. Pure muscle. Gul misses the mark again, forgettable spell today. Ends up as a full toss low on the leg stump, and Thisara drills it past him, to the right of mid off. The ball flew away in a hurry along the turf.

tight couple, but they make it in the end. Harper says not out and sticks to his decision, though Afridi implores him to go upstairs. Full ball from Shoaib on the pads, he tries to lap it square and hurries back for a second. Just in time,

did someone give Silva Red Bull? He's certainly got wings now. Short ball from Akhtar, and out of nowhere, Silva murders it in front of midwicket. Finishes with a swagger as he sees it early and connects emphatically. The crowd is buzzing now.
short ball, Silva looks to heave over the leg side again, but gets only a single to backward square leg

Perera is dropped by Younis. As always he wants to play the expansive pull. Shoaib sees him and bowls a slow short offcutter on leg stump, Perera goes for the pull and gets a top edge, Younis runs back from short fine leg, dives away and makes a superb effort, but he can't hold on.

Shoaib Akhtar - rearranging stumps and landing like an aeroplane since 1997. What a legend. Thisara is gone. He finds out the hard way, than you can't set yourself up for pre-meditated slogs against the world's fastest. He moves the front foot away and looks to heave. Shoaib fires it full and fast, and removes the timber. Get ready for landing folks.
full toss on Kula's pads first up, he gets it away to midwicket. Can't get the single though.

Silva's vigil ends. Rehman can't believe it. Kamran's actually effected a stumping off his bowling. Silva dawdles out of the crease, he looks for the heave. Rehman smartly gets it to drift away from him, and gets it past his stretched swipe. Kamran collects and breaks the stumps. Even he looks sheepish.

run out appeal goes upstairs. Fired in flat on off stump, Herath looks to sweep and misses. Lbw appeal is turned down. It runs away to the of side and they try to steal a single. Herath made it in the nick of time as the throw missed. No marks for guessing that Rehman was not ready to collect the throw, behind the stumps.
Kula picks four, nifty work from him, opens the face and dabs Rehman with the angle and turn to third man.
Rehman shifts to round the wicket, and ties up Kula with a tight ball on middle and leg.
beats him outside off this time, as Kula looks to cut and misses

Pakistan's fielding - what a shambles. Kula backs away and carves over the infield, Shehzad fields and relays to Umatr Akmal running back, who misses. To be fair, it was a really poor relay throw. They pick up three.
Herath sweeps with control and picks up a couple to end the over. Both teams have played quite badly in the recent past, and as a result this game is still open, though Pakistan are favourites.
full on off stump, Herath opens the face and steers straight to point

slow bouncer, Shoaib at his best. Herath can't even imagine a bumper at 111 kph, tries to duck, weave and eventually just stays out of the way as it flies slowly past his head. Kamran, as always, fumbles.
full length ball, searing in from outside off, and driven by Kula off the backfoot to extra cover for one
low full toss outside Herath's off stump and he drives it without enough power to wide long on for one
Kula manages to get under a nearly perfect yorker and loft it cleanly down to long on. Poor return from Umar Akmal, who runs across and fields, and they end up getting two

Kula is not giving up just yet. Backs away to the leg side, and Shoaib responds with a bouncer on off stump. Kula keeps his cool and slaps it high over point for a couple before deep cover can get across.
nice bowling, saw Herath moving around, stopped and then delivered it full on off stump. He can't connect the sweep and gets a leg bye to the off side
dropped by Hafeez. Anyone keeping track of the drops? Full toss outside off, he slaps it back real hard and Hafeez can't hold on.
Herath gets another single through wide mid off, full on off stump and driven along the ground
Kula searches for the hitting length, but Hafeez is keeping it real full. He manages to hit this reasonably well to long on, but the fielder keeps it away from the boundary
Herath just sweeps. That's all he does all the time. Leg bye as he misses.
that's the blow they needed. Kula connects with a low full toss on leg stump and thumps it over midwicket. 18 required off 6. Pakistan still ahead.
Herath can't connect. Back of a length and angling across, he looks to swing it away to the leg side. He misses. No surprises there. Kamran collects. Big surprise there.

right, he's got a single. Kula needs to hit more that four fours to win this game. Four fours will tie it. Full delivery on the stumps, another cross-batted heave and an inside edge to short fine leg, who does extremely well to dive and keep it down to one
that's one of 'em four fours. Some finish this. Gul gives him just enough width outside off for Kula to swing his arms hard at it. It hits the outside edge, and flies away unimpeded to third man

two things that rarely happened today just happened. Gul landed a yorker. And Kamran pouched a tough catch. Superb ball this, follows Kula as he backs away and it goes right through him. Kamran dives to the left and collects. He stands up sheepishly and claps for Gul. A smile on the face too.

Gul has a wicket and Kula's free-scoring surge has come to an end. Not a yorker this time, it was a low full toss on leg stump and Kula couldn't get as much muscle under it as he would have wanted. Still went through with the shot, backing away and looking to launch it over long on. He found the fielder.

all over, after a lot of fuss. Pakistan had no business losing this, but they made a really solid effort. In the end, it was not enough, since Sri Lanka made more than their share of mistakes too. Murali backs away and looks to swing across the line, it hits his pads and goes to the leg side for a leg bye. Sighs of relief being heaved everywhere on the field
